perturbation.original_text: Each Party will pay all earned and undisputed outstanding amounts owed to the other Party under this Agreement within thirty (30) days after the effective date of such termination.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party will pay all earned and undisputed outstanding amounts owed to the other Party under this Agreement within ninety (90) days after the effective date of such termination.
perturbation.explanation: The modification extends the payment deadline post-termination from 30 to 90 days. This could cause financial distress if the payout delay puts undue strain on the operational costs. This extension potentially introduces non-compliance with prompt payment regulations, which in many jurisdictions dictate quicker payment timelines to prevent undue financial burden, making the 90-day term potentially unreasonable and legally questionable.

perturbation.original_text: Any notice under this Agreement will be in writing and delivered by personal delivery, express courier, confirmed facsimile, confirmed email or certified or registered mail, return receipt requested, and will be deemed given upon personal delivery, one (1) day after deposit with express courier, upon confirmation of receipt of facsimile or email or five (5) days after deposit in the mail.
perturbation.changed_text: Any notice under this Agreement will be in writing and delivered by standard mail, and will be deemed given twenty (20) days after deposit in the mail.
perturbation.explanation: The modification replaces accepted methods of delivery such as personal delivery, express courier, confirmed email, or facsimile with standard mail and changes the receipt timeframe to 20 days after mailing. This extended timeframe is inadequate and poses risks, especially for time-sensitive legal notifications, potentially impacting parties' rights. The change could conflict with regulations that require reasonable and timely notification, making a 20-day standard mail timeline problematic for critical legal and contractual communications.
